Package engine.forPiece

Class Rook

java.lang.Object
engine.forPiece.Piece
engine.forPiece.Rook
public final class Rook extends Piece
The Rook class represents a rook chess piece. It extends the Piece class and defines the specific properties and behaviors of a rook on the chess board. Rooks move horizontally and vertically across the board.

This class provides methods for calculating legal moves for a rook, including horizontal and vertical moves, as well as capturing opponent pieces. It precomputes valid move lines for each tile on the board, taking into account edge cases and exclusions.
Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Field Details

    • CANDIDATE_MOVE_COORDINATES

      private static final int[] CANDIDATE_MOVE_COORDINATES
      An array of candidate move offsets for a rook. These values represent the possible directions (horizontally and vertically) that a rook can move on the chessboard.

    • PRECOMPUTED_CANDIDATES

      private static final Map<Integer,MoveUtils.Line[]> PRECOMPUTED_CANDIDATES
      A precomputed map that stores the valid candidate move lines for each tile on the chessboard. Each entry in the map represents the possible move paths for a rook piece from a specific tile.

  • Constructor Details

    • Rook

      public Rook(Alliance alliance, int piecePosition)
      Constructs a rook chess piece with the given alliance and starting position.
      Parameters:
      alliance - The alliance (color) of the rook (WHITE or BLACK).
      piecePosition - The position of the rook on the chessboard.

    • Rook

      public Rook(Alliance alliance, int piecePosition, boolean isFirstMove)
      Constructs a rook chess piece with the given alliance, starting position, and move history.
      Parameters:
      alliance - The alliance (color) of the rook (WHITE or BLACK).
      piecePosition - The position of the rook on the chessboard.
      isFirstMove - Indicates whether this is the rook's first move.

  • Method Details

    • computeCandidates

      private static Map<Integer,MoveUtils.Line[]> computeCandidates()
      Computes and precomputes the valid candidate move lines for each tile on the chessboard. These lines represent the possible move paths for a rook piece.
      Returns:
      A map of tile positions to precomputed candidate move lines.

    • calculateLegalMoves

      public Collection<Move> calculateLegalMoves(Board board)
      Calculates the legal moves that the rook can make on the given chess board. A rook can move horizontally or vertically across the board, capturing opponent pieces along the way.
      Specified by:
      calculateLegalMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      A collection of legal moves that the rook can make.

    • locationBonus

      public int locationBonus()
      Provides a location bonus value for the rook piece on the board. The bonus is determined based on the rook's current position and alliance. This bonus value contributes to evaluating the piece's strategic importance.
      Specified by:
      locationBonus in class Piece
      Returns:
      The location bonus value for the rook.

    • movePiece

      public Rook movePiece(Move move)
      Creates a new rook piece after a given move is made. This method is used to update the piece's position after a legal move is executed on the board.
      Specified by:
      movePiece in class Piece
      Parameters:
      move - The move that is being made.
      Returns:
      A new rook piece after the specified move is made on the chessboard.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the rook piece. R for the white player and r for the black player.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the rook piece.

    • isColumnExclusion

      private static boolean isColumnExclusion(int position, int offset)
      Checks if a given position is at the edge of a column on the chessboard and if the given offset is valid for moving horizontally.
      Parameters:
      position - The position to check.
      offset - The offset value.
      Returns:
      True if the position is at the column edge and the offset is valid for horizontal movement, false otherwise.
